Description: Body fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery vessel, the glaze fired to red (10 R 5/6). Feline to left, its rear legs and part of its belly preserved; to right probably a seated feline or sphinx, its tail and haunch partly preserved; incised and unincised circular rosettes in the field. A band below the picture with added red line.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 11, no. 30 pl. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.900)
